Security: Registry keys that affect Windows security, permissions, and access control.
Startup: Programs and services that automatically start with Windows.
Network: Settings related to network configuration, TCP/IP, DNS, and connectivity.
User Interface: Visual, appearance, and personalization settings for Windows.
System Core: Low-level configuration for Windows services, drivers, and the kernel.
Updates: Windows Update, patching behavior, and automatic update configuration.
Performance: Settings related to system responsiveness, timeouts, and optimization.
Privacy: Options related to telemetry, diagnostic data collection, and user privacy controls.
Display: Monitor, resolution, scaling, and color-related configuration.
Audio: Registry entries controlling sound devices, volume, and driver behavior.
